tag_list: ceo, president, navigenics, stanford, babycenter, consumer-marketer
overview:
Mari currently serves as an emeritus trustee of Stanford University and director of Cozi Group, Inc. She has been recognized in the San Mateo County Women’s Hall of Fame, Fortune’s list of Silicon Valley’s Most Influential Women, and Advertising Age’s Top 100.

Previously, Mari Baker was was president and CEO of PlayFirst, Inc., a mobile games company. She served as CEO of Navigenics before that, a company she helped incubate while an executive-in-residence at the venture capital firm, Kleiner Perkins Caulfield and Byers.

Previously, as president and CEO of BabyCenter, an online site for moms, Mari drove market leading growth and managed the eventual acquisition by Johnson & Johnson.

Mari established herself as a premier consumer marketer at Intuit where she built Quicken into the world’s most popular personal finance software.

Mari is a graduate from Stanford University and holds degrees in economics and sociology.
